title: Textile, "Les Martyrs de Chateaubriand", ca. 1840
medium: Printed by engraved roller on cotton plain weave,
dimensions:
Warp: 125cm (49 1/4in.). Weft: 79cm (31 1/8in). Both edges cut.
Height of repeat: 48.5cm
description: Five scenes of Christian martyrs in Rome. Scenes of a tiger attacking Eudore and Clicoduee at the center. In ocher (color called bistre in French) on white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, "Les Martyrs de Chateaubriand", ca. 1840.
ca. 1840. Printed by engraved roller on cotton plain weave,. Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-202.
